Don't take my word for it, people love this oil:

"Amazing product from an amazing seller. I was excited to try the scent of petrichor after everything I had read about it, and to my delight it really does smell like fresh soil after a rain, or even the hot cobbled streets of Paris in the summer after a summer rain, very soothing. "
fleurdodd on Sep 23, 2016


I love this scent. It's a natural extract made from only one lake in Kannauj India. A summer storm in a bottle! The monsoons clearing the dust from the streets in india. This scent has many names -- petrichor, mitti, geosmine -- and Kannuaj is the only place in the world that I have found that extracts it naturally.

If you've ever tried CB I Hate Perfume's Soaked Earth accord, this smells vastly different. Less humus and more pavement during a summer shower. 

This is rare stuff indeed and we bring it directly to you!


All of our oils are made using natural ingredients using traditional extraction methods. We source them ourselves from Kannauj India a city known to have been producing essential oils for the last 7000 years! The images above are from the factory visit in October 2015. Wear some history :). 

Here's the article on Kannauj that inspired us to visit:
www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2015/04/making-perfume-from-the-rain/391011/

<3 Bilal & Josephine

Here is the updated title, tags, and description for the Petrichor Oil listing on Etsy:

Title:
Authentic Petrichor Oil - Soaked Earth Scent - Mitti Attar - Geosmin Infused Fragrance for Perfume, Candles & Aromatherapy

Tags:
Petrichor Oil, Mitti Attar, Earth Scent, Geosmin Fragrance, Aromatherapy, Natural Perfume, Soaked Earth, Rain Scent, Earthy Perfume, Essential Oil, Indian Tradition, Rare Fragrance, Kannauj India, Scent of Rain, Monsoon Scent

Description:

Discover the captivating scent of Petrichor Oil â€“ an authentic Soaked Earth Fragrance, Mitti Attar, infused with Geosmin. This rare and alluring scent can be worn as a natural perfume, used to make candles, or enjoyed as an evocative aromatherapy experience.

Our customers love this oil, describing it as "a gentle shower in a forest" and "smelling like fresh soil after rain." Made from a unique lake in Kannauj, India, this Petrichor Oil captures the essence of a summer storm and transports you to the streets of India after a refreshing monsoon shower.

Unlike other fragrances that attempt to replicate the scent of rain-soaked earth, our Petrichor Oil is sourced directly from Kannauj, a city with a 7,000-year history of producing essential oils. By using traditional extraction methods and natural ingredients, we ensure that our oils are of the highest quality and authenticity.

With each purchase, you're not just getting a beautiful scent â€“ you're wearing a piece of history. Learn more about the fascinating story of Kannauj and its ancient perfume-making traditions here: www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2015/04/making-perfume-from-the-rain/391011/

Please note that this delivery will be coming from the US and the receiver may have to process the package according to the Customs and Border Protection of the receiving nation's guidelines.

For discounts, adventure stories, and more, sign up for our newsletter by clicking here: http://bit.ly/NCSLetter

* Important to note, we do not provide tracking numbers for sample size bottles purchased alone.

Experience the magic of Petrichor Oil for yourself â€“ add to cart now and let the scent of rain transport you to another world.

Â Here's some language that you can use to make the tone sound more like us, also keep in mind the SEO and sales and keep it sounding authentic like we wrote it: 
What is Nur Creative Studios? Why does it exist?

Warning, this is a bit of a long read and is a thesis on why I want to run a business. I hope to get feedback and polish this till it includes all our ideas and visions.

Please read this and tell me at the end, why are you here?

Trying to simplify what Nur Creative Studios aims to:
Create products which give people a sense of the sublime.
Run a company that is fueled by baraka, so that the work we do is blessed and so that the money we make is also blessed. 
"Good Globalization" - connect a the planet through our products by collaborating with crafts people from around the world. 
Create quality products that help people know themselves, each other, and know how the world works. How amazing is that?
Create a vehicle through which we meaning for the employees, partner producers, and customers.

Once upon a time, 10 years ago, we started a creative studio called Modati. Our goal was simple. To make money doing what we love. But that's too simple, what does making money mean - what does "doing what we love" mean?

We must expand the idea of making money to mean something bigger than collecting green stuff and for it to mean that we thrive participating in a collaborative global economy. And by "doing what we love" means to: using my strengths to offer value to others, and to challenge myself to grow more so I can give more.

Let's try to simplify that. NCS is a company through which I can grow more so I can serve more. When I serve more, I earn more. I earn more to help others serve and create. I know my satisfaction does not come from 

Nur Creative Studios was born from the desire to connect to the divine* through our senses. We create products to know that God did not create humanity to suffer, but to delight in our senses and knowing. We create experiences of beauty that transcend the aesthetic and moves us through awe and wonder to know the divine. 

What does that even mean, Bilal? Well, what I'm trying to say is that every time you smell a beautiful flower and smile, there's god* waving at you smiling back. 

To make sure our products are able to evoke a divine sense of beauty we must ensure that no negativity enters them from any channel. That means that our production line must be full of baraka, so that our products are full of baraka, so that we are funded by money that's blessed. That means we pay everyone respectfully. That means we respect every hand that has to put effort to make our products. That means we respect our customers and charge fair prices. 

Another principle element of the brand is beautiful globalization. A form of globalization that focuses on appreciation of differences rather than creating a bland culture that is the same all over the world. We are an international team, working with international crafts people many of whom have been working on these traditional crafts for their whole lives, in cities known for the crafts for thousands of years. Let's use an international product to demonstrate the long history and beauty of different parts of the world. This globalization helps people travel without leaving their countries. 

That leads us to travel. Travel helps one to see and learn how other people live, to understand the integrated nature of the world, and to hopefully, learn to accept the other. This is another form of beauty, and another way of demonstrating the unity of mankind, which is a mirror of the unity of divinity*. We help connect people and the world by telling compelling stories. And by LITERALLY bringing parts of one world and taking it to another. It's different than a photo, a scent is much more visceral and substantial.

Another element of a beautiful company is what we do with the profits. I want some of our profits to go to mitigating any negative affects our business could be having in terms of resources being utilized. So reforesting for the paper and trees we use for instance. I want to have some resources for new product development, exploring new materials and research, and 

I want to have no death on my hands, which means that everyone that works on nuries should feel like they are challenged, growing (positive pain), and happily engaged using their strengths - rather than trying to bolster a weakness or like they are compensated inappropriately.

I thought we just buy and sell oils. - No, we make friends around the world, we highlight the efforts of crafts people, we make the argument that meaning is our job. 

Companies evolve, their missions change, the people decide. I'm sharing my values and missions and open to hear from you how you want to create this thing. Having a creative studio like this allows us to explore the world, create value, share with others. We get to understand ourselves through sharing the things we make. 

I hope this adventure grows with us. I hope to hear from you why you are here. What you would like to explore. What your strengths are. What would you like to contribute. How can NCS be helpful for you in achieving your goals? What time do you have to offer to this initiative?

Hope you're all doing lovely and please tell us all... "what are you doing here?"
What are your thoughts on economics, sustainable planets, sustainable living, how a business should be run, what products you want to create, what you have to offer in service to the world.

At Nur Creative Studios, we're on a mission to create products that evoke a sense of the sublime, bring people together, and celebrate the beauty of our diverse world. Our passion for fair trade, ethical production, and global collaboration has led us to create fragrances that transport our customers to the far reaches of the Earth, while supporting local craftspeople and communities.

Why does Nur Creative Studios exist? We believe that a business should be more than just about making money. It should be a force for good in the world, fostering connections between people, cultures, and the environment. Our aim is to create quality products that help people know themselves and each other, while promoting sustainable living and a respect for our planet.

Through our partnerships with artisans around the world, we showcase the rich history and beauty of traditional crafts, offering our customers a unique sensory experience. Our fragrances are not only crafted with love and care, but they also carry a story â€“ a story of the people, lands, and traditions that have shaped them.

We're committed to making a positive impact on the world, not only through our products but also through our business practices. This means respecting the environment, investing in sustainable initiatives, and ensuring that everyone involved in our production process is treated fairly and with dignity.

Nur Creative Studios is more than just a fragrance company â€“ we're a community of creative individuals who share a common goal of making the world a more beautiful and connected place. We invite you to join us on this journey, to share your thoughts on economics, sustainable living, and how a business should be run, as well as your ideas for new products and ways to serve the world.

Together, let's make Nur Creative Studios a beacon of hope, beauty, and unity, and show the world that it's possible to create a thriving business that values people, the planet, and the divine beauty that connects us all.

Embrace the captivating essence of Nur Coop's Lebanese Amber Essential Oil Blend. This one-of-a-kind creation combines the richness of amber with the allure of traditional Lebanese scents to bring you a truly luxurious sensory experience.

Our blend is a harmonious fusion of warm, earthy amber, with a delicate balance of caramel, sweet orange, and hints of vanilla. This remarkable mixture represents the beauty of Lebanon and its rich history, reflecting the spirit of the Mediterranean region in every drop.

Crafted in the North of Lebanon, our Amber Essential Oil Blend is made with 100% pure, natural ingredients, ensuring the highest quality and potency.

Customer Reviews:
"I absolutely adore this amber blend. It's warm, inviting, and has a beautiful depth to it. I use it in my diffuser and it fills my home with an enchanting aroma." - Sarah

"The perfect balance of sweet and earthy. It's become my go-to scent for both personal use and in my homemade soaps. I can't get enough of it!" - Jessica

Fun Fact: Amber is highly valued in Lebanon and is even considered a national treasure. The country's amber deposits date back millions of years, preserving fascinating remnants of ancient flora and fauna. The use of amber in Lebanese culture and perfumery is a testament to the nation's rich heritage and appreciation for this precious material.

This luxurious oil blend can be used in various ways, including as a personal perfume, a welcoming and comforting diffused aroma, or incorporated into handmade soaps and candles.

Immerse yourself in the enchanting world of Lebanese scents with Nur Coop's Amber Essential Oil Blend. Order yours today and experience the magic for yourself!

Tags: Lebanese Amber, Amber Essential Oil, Essential Oil Blend, Aromatherapy, Natural Perfume, Organic, Vanilla Orange Caramel, Unique Scent, Made in Lebanon, Nur Coop

Highlights
Materials: sandalwood
Description
Enjoy a pure sandalwood essential oil. For thousands of years it has been long used as a cosmetic and fragrance due to its calming and harmonizing effect on the mind. This makes sandalwood great to use for meditation. 

This sandalwood is gently powerful, woody, oily and delicious. A warm scent to treat yourself or your loved ones on a cold day. It makes me happy just smelling it and I hope it does the same for you.


All of our oils are made using natural ingredients using traditional extraction methods. We source them ourselves from Kannauj India a city known to have been producing essential oils for the last 7000 years! The images above are from the factory visit in October 2015. Wear some history :). 

Here's the article on Kannauj that inspired us to visit:
www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2015/04/making-perfume-from-the-rain/391011/
